Job Description: We are seeking a?Business Analyst (focus on Robot Automation/PowerAutomate) who will be responsible for preparation and execution of improvements working with the RPA and Microsoft PowerPlatform. You will work together with a dynamic team focused towards Digital Transformation; Automate tasks and processes using UiPath, Power Automate/Flow, Azure Logic Apps to better serve users and stakeholders.Over deze functieThe essence of the role of the Analyst is to:Create business process workflows with direct impact on Quality, Speed and Productivity for the (operational/sales) end-user.Monitor, improve, develop business process workflows using the Microsoft Power Automate platform.Maintain development robots in cooperation with the business and IT.Not only create insights, but to make them understandable and thereby actionable for the entire organization. You do so by transforming insights into clear and useful dashboards, reports and communication, by setting goals and targets and by interpreting and translating data. Propose improvements and optimizations based on possibilities wiring the RPA tooling and PowerAutomate platform.The main deliverables in the first 6 months as Business Analyst are:Get familiar with the current business improvement projectsGet familiar with the IT environment Keep track of improvement projectsAdvise the business and IT in imitations and possibilities during improvement projectsMaintain and sustain improvementsDiscover and initiate future improvementsDevelop the automation competence within Global ITThe main activities as an Analyst are:Analyze processes withing and between different departmentsPrepare improvement projectsParticipate as advisor in project meetingsMaintain robotics platformSpark new improvement opportunities for regional IT service managersOver jouA completed education at hbo or wo level;At least 1 years of experience in a similar position;Fluent English and Dutch language in word and writing;Proven experience in data analysis or business pocess managementUnderstanding of digital dynamics (onsite optimization, digital channel performance, basic digital KPI’s)Analytical;Pragmatic;Results-oriented;Independent and self-starting approach;Teamplayer;Commercial insight Inderstandign PowerPlatfrom, PowerApps, PowerAutomate (pré)Understanding Robots UiPath (pré)Wat wij biedenBrunel offers outstanding individuals a highly diverse and challenging job opportunity in a company where an open, professional and pleasant working culture is greatly valued; where your personal initiatives will be noticed and rewarded; and where you will receive all the support, coaching and training you need for your future career. This is your opportunity to discover a wide range of sectors and activities and develop your expertise in a fast-moving and results-oriented environment. Being intermediated by Brunel means that you are contracted by Brunel. Not only you will have a contract, you will as well be assured of a great career! Our primary and secondary terms of work are excellent. A few examples are price reductions at CZ Health Insurance, bonus opportunities and standard 26 days off.Over onsFounded in 1975, Brunel International is a publicly listed global company with over 10,000 employees. Brunel responds to the global demand for specific expertise and flexible employment by developing innovative and compliant global workforce services and solutions. The company is specialised in the oil & gas, renewables, mining, infrastructure and automotive industry sectors. We operate in various industry sectors globally serving (major) international customers around the world. The division's strength is the combination of a global infrastructure of registered own offices (six global regions and offices in more than 40 countries) pared with a strong local network and expertise. Brunel is a flat organisation with a strong commercial drive. The company culture is informal, international and results-driven with a passion for people. Ownership is placed as low as possible in the organization and employees are selected for their levels of entrepreneurship, integrity and professionalism.

Corbion develops sustainable solutions to improve the quality of life for people today and for future generations.The Master Data steward is accountable for ensuring the quality of the Master Data put in SAP and that the master data structure within SAP is set up in alignment with a best in class governance process. He/she is responsible for coordinating master data from multiple regions ensuring high quality master data. This person must have the ability to envision the linkage data structures from a global perspective as well as aligning with local master data providers.ResponsibilitiesMaster DataSet up planning master data in SAP ad OMP. This starts with local input from workflows together with centrally added master data. It is important to ensure an accurate and complete setup of the transportation routes and zones over different units within Corbion depending on where the material will be produced, sold or bought;Ensuring the linkage of master globally, alignment with material master data and ensures proper structure for reporting;Train and support the regional teams to enrich the current master set up in the SAP material master module including but not limited to: data related to supply chain, purchase info records, source lists other data to ensure an accurate planning;Managing master data in satellite systems that impact transactions in SAP.Data QualityData mining exercises to identify quality issues, root causes, and resolution based on best practicesPeriodically audit data to identify areas that require additional focusData GovernanceEnsure proper control and change management across the global regionsEstablish and enforce data policies and process improvementsEstablish key metrics, report creation, and complex data extractionsTrain and support the regional master data providers to properly define the master data required in SAPSupport implementation of master data governance tooling.About youRequired SAP master data experience 1-3 years / 3-5 years SAP experience;Planning background required;Ability to be a strong advocate for process adherence;Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from the executive leadership team and business customers at all levels;Strong stakeholder collaboration and team player approach;Self-starter who brings an entrepreneurial approach to driving long term value;Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.About CorbionCorbion is the global market leader in lactic acid and its derivatives, and a leading supplier of emulsifiers, functional enzyme blends, minerals, vitamins, and algae ingredients. We use our unique expertise in fermentation and other processes to deliver sustainable solutions for the preservation of food and food production, health, and our planet. For over 100 years, we have been uncompromising in our commitment to safety, quality, innovation and performance. Drawing on our deep application and product knowledge, we work side-by-side with customers to make our cutting-edge technologies work for them. Our solutions help differentiate products in markets such as food, home & personal care, animal nutrition, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and bioplastics. In 2019, Corbion generated annual sales of € 976.4 million and had a workforce of 2.138 FTE. Corbion is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. For more information: www.corbion.comCorbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.

Philips challenges you to use your analytical and project management skills to create growth for our business and yourself. The goal is to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into global business decisions. You will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design; develop analysis and reporting capabilities; and monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.Your responsibilitiesAs a Digital Data Lead, you will :Support the growth and development of our Coffee Digital platforms (web, app, appliance)Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsDevelop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and qualityAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsWork with management to prioritize business and information needsLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesBuild predictive models and define machine-learning needsYour teamYou will be part of the Coffee team in Amsterdam a dedicated group of Marketers, business developers digital Managers within the Business Group Domestic Appliances. As a Digital Data Lead, you will be the key contact between Coffee and all relevant "data" partners across the company (e.g. I&D team and supplier, Marketing Intelligence, Business Group & Commercial Organization Market 2 Order teams, Strategy etc.) and outside (e.g. ecosystem partners etc.).Our offerWe welcome you to a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to explore.We are looking forExperience & Qualifications & KnowledgeProven up to 5 years working experience as a Data scientist / AnalystTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesStrong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findingsBS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsPersonality CharacteristicsConfident communicator capable of inspiring strong collaboration in an organizationVery organized and good at planningEntrepreneurial with creative natureResults driven and pro-activeAbility to identify and solve problemsSelf-reliant and Change leader

Role: Accenture Trading, Investment and Optimization Strategy ManagerLevel: ManagerLocation: Abu Dhabi/ DubaiAbout AccentureAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 505,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Visit us at www.accenture.com.Strategy practice (ATIOS), part of Accenture Strategy, is a global practice operating across multiple industries. Comprised of three core capability areas, the ATIOS team focuses on Trading and Risk Management, Investment Valuation and Financial Structuring and Optimization. It is one of the few global strategy practices which provides a very steep cross-industry learning curve and a truly global professional experience, working with organizations focused on commodity production, trading, logistics and marketing.We combine our unique industry knowledge in the energy, chemicals, soft commodities, agriculture, metals, mining, utilities, transportation and consumer goods amongst others with analytics-powered core strategy consulting skills, digital and applied intelligence to create unsurpassed value for our clients across the world.Key responsibilities:Client Delivery and DevelopmentManage project and client teams to solve complex business issues in one of our three core capability areas, bringing structure and rigorous quantitative and qualitative skills to deliver actionable recommendations, insights and resultsDay-to-day management of projects / large workstreams with minimum supervision to identify value creation opportunities for our clients, helping drive the project to a successful outcomeReview, lead and develop analysis required to support project deliveryLead and conduct client interviews and workshops, develop presentation materials and engage in client conversations, articulating approach and recommendationsWork on topics including strategy development, due diligence, trading and risk management capability set-up, operating model design, process design and support analytics development and implementationDevelop and sustain senior executive client relationships by remaining highly attuned to client needs and styles, and remaining market relevant through the development of thought leadership pieces and taking fresh/disruptive ideas to clientsDevelop and manage project teams, coaching, mentoring and supporting analysts and consultants in building and enhancing their core consulting skill setsPractice BuildingContribute to developing the ATIOS and wider Accenture Strategy practice and community, and building ATIOS offerings, assets and thought leadershipSupport internal Business Development activities by conducting and managing industry and company-specific research (competitors, market scanning and market fundamentals, financials, customers, etc.), as well as the development of client proposal presentationsDevelop and coach other Accenture strategists, leading by example, actively mentoring others and contributing to performance management and training activities
Required ExperienceAn above average Master’s degree in a relevant subject from a leading academic institution [undergraduate degree in Sciences or Engineering or Finance or Economics; MBA or Master’s Degree is preferred]6-8 years professional experience at minimum in either a strategy consulting firm working in commodity markets, investment banking or a relevant position in industryKnowledge of how global markets operate and an understanding of commodity trendsDemonstrable exposure to one or more of the following industries: energy, chemicals, soft commodities, agriculture, metals, mining, utilities, transportation, consumer goods, capital marketsTrack-record of project management and client facing roles as well as team leadership experienceFamiliarity with recognized strategy frameworks and techniques; experience in research and data analysisGood quantitative skills, with Excel/VBA as a minimum and other modelling packages a plusExperience in business case development, financial analysis and a demonstrable understanding of financial statementsExperience in leading / contributing to teams and delivering complex strategy / consulting engagementsDemonstrable exposure to digital, analytics and/or applied intelligence would be a distinct advantageWhy join us?We offer a transparent, fast paced approach career progression, with a focus on your strengths and continuous coaching from senior colleaguesYou will benefit from working alongside Accenture experts who are solving some of the biggest industry challenges with innovative thinking and pioneering toolsFlexible work arrangements and a range of benefits including competitive rewardsYou will have access to state-of-the-art technology that will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest business trendsYou will also have opportunities to make a difference to the communities in which we work and liveNext StepsIf this sounds like the ideal role, career and company for you, click below to apply.To learn more about life @AccentureMiddleEast, follow us on social media and keep up with our latest news.Accenture Middle East: LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube
